page.title: 10Saint Saviours-Auckley
page.content: St.Saviours is claustropobic inside. The entrance is via a modern porch.The pews are of a wooden design,with brightly coloured kneelers.By the side of them is a stick, which was used to chase dogs out of church in the past. Behind the altar is the east window which is the largest in the building. It allows early morning light to enter It is a black leaded window,with diamond shaped fragments,some are frosted,some clear.The clear glass is replacement glass,caused by vandalism. The lecterns are mostly of brass.Some are of beautifully carved wood. Just on the edge of a step going up to the altar is a kind of carved bench.Next to the altar is a large window,which has 2 hooks,which were used for blackout curtains.On the wall is a plaque commemorating 3 men who were killed in World War 1.
